week_summary.key_finding: Brazil suffered largest financial cybercrime in history ($108M), while Spain maintained position as 2nd most-attacked nation globally with 45,000 daily attacks

incidents.summary: Largest cybercrime in Brazil's history. Insider at C&M Software paid R$15,000 for credentials, enabling theft of R$541 million ($108M USD) via unauthorized PIX transactions. Operations disrupted 3 hours, one arrest made, R$270M frozen.

Commercial refrigeration manufacturer hit by RansomHub ransomware. IT systems in Brazil and Mexico rendered unavailable, systems isolated to prevent spread. No confirmed data leakage but operations disrupted.

spain_incidents.summary: Despite 45,000 daily attacks, no major incidents reported during this week. Likely reflects improved defenses, summer slowdown, or delayed disclosure.
spain_incidents.business_lesson: La ausencia de incidentes reportados no significa ausencia de ataques. Mantener vigilancia constante.
